content:
That "globe" icon doesn't look great to me:

  • It's hard to make out at that size. I'm not sure I would figure out it was meant to be a globe if I didn't know.
  • It's trying to look like an actual view of a globe, which necessarily means it's a particular part of the world. (Basically centered on North America, it looks like.)

Can we use a grid-style globe instead?

Ha, I guess Material's answer is that a grid-style globe means "language", and the icon for "public" is... basically the Western Hemisphere: image.png
https://fonts.google.com/icons?selected=Material+Icons&icon.query=globe
Though then also it reuses the Western Hemisphere globe, plus other small icons, for "Travel Explore" and for "Vpn Lock": image.png

I think if we want a map-like globe icon, Material's is at least more legible than the one in those draft screenshots. Also I feel like not being centered blatantly right on North America is an improvement.

I'd also be happy to see a grid-style globe; in this context I don't think it's at risk of looking like it means "choose your language".

I guess the globe discussion is somewhat separate from this particular PR, unless we think it's specifically a deal-breaker for whether or not to use a globe in that banner. We should settle on consistent iconography throughout:

Screen-Shot-2022-01-07-at-11.22.12-AM.png

I agree that it's nice that the Material Design globe is less focused on North America. The language connotation makes me worry about using a grid-style globe, though it looks like we currently don't use that icon in the language settings.
Yeah, agreed it should be consistent. If we're already using that globe in the sidebar, then I don't think it's any worse in that banner than there.
I think the globe might be a little worse in this spot just because of the blue font color from the link label styling, but yeah, I agree with that conclusion.
This topic was moved here from #issues > missing hash before stream name by Alya Abbott
I moved this part of the above topic so that we can discuss what icon to use for world-public streams, separately from a particular place where that icon is being used.
How about image.png
https://feathericons.com/
this icon set is already in use on mobile as far as I know
It can be bolder too image.png
Yeah, that's a bit visually simpler of a grid-style globe than the one Material has, and that might be best for using it real small, like we do with these stream icons.
Between those two Feather variations the less-bold is the one I'd try first; the bolder one's lines might blur together when it's small.

Should I try using grid-style globe for compose box and banner box stream privacy decoration in these PRs ?

  1. compose: Add stream privacy decorations compose box. #20588
  2. compose: Add stream privacy decorations in banner box. #20562

@Shivam Deotarse this needs to be a separate PR, actually. Can you replace all the fa-globe icons with globe icon vlad mentioned? Place the svg in static/assets/icons and use zulip-icon zulip-icon-globe as class to use the icon and post some screenshots?

Aman Agrawal (amanagr) said:

Shivam Deotarse this needs to be a separate PR, actually. Can you replace all the fa-globe icons with globe icon vlad mentioned? Place the svg in static/assets/icons and use zulip-icon zulip-icon-globe as class to use the icon and post some screenshots?

I have replaced fa fa-globe with zulip-icon zulip-icon-globe and also added globe.svg to static/assets/icons. But, still new icon is not visible in place of old globe icon.
Do I have to make more changes @Aman Agrawal (amanagr) ?

New globe icon is looking like this -
image.png
Hmm, that doesn't look like the right icon at all -- it doesn't look like the screenshots Vlad Korobov showed above, and it doesn't look much like a globe. Is it perhaps some other icon?
I think there is an issue with svg file
something like this had happened somehow image.png

Vlad Korobov said:

How about image.png

I have used same globe.svg as mentioned above but, color is getting filled instead of applying color to icon outline only.
I'll try that in browser tomorrow

Shivam Deotarse said:

Vlad Korobov said:

How about image.png

I have used same globe.svg as mentioned above but, color is getting filled instead of applying color to icon outline only.

@Shivam Deotarse is there a PR with this change that I could pull and look at?

Aman Agrawal (amanagr) said:

Shivam Deotarse this needs to be a separate PR, actually. Can you replace all the fa-globe icons with globe icon vlad mentioned? Place the svg in static/assets/icons and use zulip-icon zulip-icon-globe as class to use the icon and post some screenshots?

@Yash RE Actually I have followed above instructions on my local environment and have not created any PR.
I see, and you got the svg from here https://feathericons.com/?query=globe?
I looked at the svg and it doesn't have any elements which should act weirdly like that, but I'll try follow the same steps on my end and see what happens

Yash RE said:

I see, and you got the svg from here https://feathericons.com/?query=globe?

Yes, the same globe.svg
@Shivam Deotarse here is the globe icon which is a shape rather than set of lines
globe-shape.svg
it should work fine in the list of streams
I guess, the only thing that you should do is to replace fill property with currectColor, or its done in JS already and you want to remove fill property from the SVG
quick test inside the browsers tells me that now the icon is correct image.png

Cool. We'd of course want to polish the details so it looks visually centered properly if we're swapping the icon. I think I like that better visually than the existing icon; but perhaps we should do a side-by-side comparison of some sort to crystalize our thinking on that?
well I just tested that its working and svg isn't broken. As a metaphor I think is a good one.With a future design update hashtag icon would play better with this globe icon
tsker has marked this topic as resolved.
tsker has marked this topic as unresolved.
@Shivam Deotarse let me take over this issue.
Screenshot-2022-02-15-at-7.12.56-PM.png Screenshot-2022-02-15-at-7.13.10-PM.png
I like the current icon better. It is easier on my eyes and more intuitive.
The question is if it should be easier or not
I'm not that picky about little things, but other might be... the world on the current icon is North America :smile:
Well, I see the icon as NA being a part of the world.
I'm ok with any icon... for some reason I thought that public stream should be very distinctive. The current globe icon is easy to lose among the others
(note that we have some broader discussion on #design > web public streams )

@Aman Agrawal (amanagr) the icons in your screenshot are different sizes — is it possible to scale the new one so it's the same size? It's hard to compare, changing the icon and size at the same time.
Screenshot-2022-02-15-at-7.52.08-PM.png
These don't feel bad after using the UI with them for a while.
Could you share a screenshot for a logged in user? I'd be curious how it looks next to hashes for regular public streams; I'm guessing the newly proposed icon might fit well with them stylistically.

re: North America

It's probably not a huge deal, but it is a common complaint of folks on the non-north-america part of the world that the "default" side of the world is usually not theirs. I remember something about Facebook changing it depending on location

Obscure comedy reference to globes:

https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=a9eTru16aDc

Alya Abbott said:

Could you share a screenshot for a logged in user? I'd be curious how it looks next to hashes for regular public streams; I'm guessing the newly proposed icon might fit well with them stylistically.

image.png
I see an alignment problem: the column of hashes and globes is centered in the left sidebar, but left-aligned in the recent topics list.
The vertical alignment looks a little off too, unless I'm imagining it?
But I like the new globe.
You￼￼ are correct about alignment guys
The mobile app displays the same globe icon that the web app does now, if this changes we'll want to be able to use it in the app as well.
Let's get a version of this we can test-deploy, so we can validate this change.
The updated globe icon has been merged and is running here.
There's one outstanding bug here that I'm aware of, which is not new with the updated icon, which is that "Recent topics" doesn't align things how we will want it to.
I like how it looks in the left sidebar!
The icon is misaligned and not colored in the navbar.
Hmm, maybe its not "misaligned" since its very close to the alignment in the FRB but the alignment does not look good.

Hm, I think we have a general issue that applies to the private stream icon as well, which is that the vertical alignment seems to be different in the left sidebar vs. the navbar vs. the message header bar.
This change hasn't been announced in #chat.zulip.org .
I think the original icon conveys the fact that it is web public better, because it is unmistakenly a globe.
I'll revisit the icon in the new design.
The new icon is cleaner to me, but yeah, the old icon conveyed globe better.
I also like the new icon, but I think there is always room for improvement.

Yash RE said:

Hmm, maybe its not "misaligned" since its very close to the alignment in the FRB but the alignment does not look good.

Opened #21295.
You know what guys
The icon is currently used isn’t the one I thought we would
4E568C04-070E-4574-8517-B5E609A187DC.png
Aman, you shared a screen earlier with a proper icon. The one I see in Zulip web - is a wrong one

Rein Zustand said:

This change hasn't been announced in #chat.zulip.org .

I believe our current plan is to announce experiments, and not all features that are merged to main and will be rolled out to Zulip Cloud soon (like this one). We may announce some features like this if we specifically need feedback on them, but I don't think we want to create overhead for Tim Abbott any time a feature is merged.
Yash you screenshot is showing a wrong icon
Hmm... @Aman Agrawal (amanagr) FYI
Just putting this out there, if we could use the one from FeatherIcons that Vlad posted a screenshot of, it would make things a bit easier on the technical side :)

Austin Riba said:

Just putting this out there, if we could use the one from FeatherIcons that Vlad posted a screenshot of, it would make things a bit easier on the technical side :smile:

I responded in #mobile-team > custom icons on this front, but I think those technical issues are very solvable and we will likely want to solve for other reasons, so I think it'd be better to focus on what icon we think is best.

That said, I tend to agree that the Font Awesome globe is much more obviously a globe to me. It's possible that consideration is more important than the potential inclusivity benefits of not displaying a specific set of continents; I think we'll probably have a better sense of that when we begin public beta usage next week.

Vlad Korobov said:

The icon is currently used isn’t the one I thought we would

Oops, I must have used the wrong svg. I was experimenting with different ones.

image.png
image.png

How does it look now? I pushed the icon 0.5px below the adjacent text so that it doesn't look misaligned.

Vlad Korobov said:

I guess, the only thing that you should do is to replace fill property with currectColor, or its done in JS already and you want to remove fill property from the SVG

You identified the issue correctly here but the solution doesn't work in our case when the svg is rendered as a font. So, I had to convert the icon to png and back to svg so that it renders differently. (As coordinates instead of a shape)
What

I guess that’s why it’s slightly asymmetric and 4× longer than it needs to be. (The function you were looking for is Inkscape’s Stroke to Path.)

Thanks, that works well. I am not sure if it looks better, though.

stroke to path
svg to png to svg

One downside of this icon is that it will not make any sense on high resolution screens.
4k screen 100%
I am waiting on some feedback from others here.
@Aman Agrawal (amanagr) can we try that one icon-earth.svg ?
Please remember to preserve licensing and attribution information when proposing icons. And if this is an icon available in an NPM package, we should import it that way rather than copying the file.

icon-earth.svg seems to have the focus on North America problem we were trying to steer clear of, though perhaps there's more ocean than in the original one?

The stroke to path screenshot above looks fine to me. I like that style of globe next to the hashes.
For the high res screenshot, I think you'd have to zoom in for the text to be readable in any case.

Anders Kaseorg said:

Please remember to preserve licensing and attribution information when proposing icons. And if this is an icon available in an NPM package, we should import it that way rather than copying the file.

I do remember about it. I'm using either Feather icons or my commercial license to icons8.com or drawing icons myself.

Alya Abbott said:

icon-earth.svg seems to have the focus on North America problem we were trying to steer clear of, though perhaps there's more ocean than in the original one?

The stroke to path screenshot above looks fine to me. I like that style of globe next to the hashes.

Icon is a symbol, I didn't know that there was some goal to don't show something. I don't think we should optimize for that. The goal should be a better metaphor recognition. But if you prefer the initial globe that I suggested instead of this one I'm ok with that.

We generally can't use icons from a paid source -- it seems very likely such icons would have a license that restricts redistribution that would not be compatible with our open source license for Zulip overall.
(I haven't looked up the licensing rules for icons8.com)
Do I need to get some kind of license confirmation?
About the icon itself, would something like this be better? image.png
https://www.svgrepo.com/vectors/globe/ has some interesting open source licensed icons.
Screenshot-2022-03-16-at-11.24.50-AM.png Screenshot-2022-03-16-at-11.27.57-AM.png Screenshot-2022-03-16-at-11.28.47-AM.png
Screenshot-2022-03-16-at-11.30.49-AM.png
Screenshot-2022-03-16-at-11.35.07-AM.png
(ignore the alignment for now)

The Icons8 license has several clauses that are clearly incompatible with inclusion in an open-source project.

The Licensee may not:

  • Sublicense, distribute, sell, assign, convey, or otherwise transfer this license nor any of the Licensee's rights, duties, or legal responsibilities under this Agreement;
  • Sell, resell, license, or distribute its' final product in a manner allowing others or third parties to extract or access Licensed Material as stand-alone files;
    …
  • Distribute, export, post, upload, or download Licensed Material online in a the downloadable format or enable Licensed Material to be accessed; downloaded, or distributed in any manner that would be prohibited by this Agreement;

which is pretty typical for commercial asset licensing.

Just so I understand, do folks have some concern about using the icon Vlad suggested earlier?

Vlad Korobov said:

How about image.png
Feather-icons is a fine source (MIT license).

Material design icons (Apache 2.0 license) has an identical icon to Vlad’s icon-earth.svg. (It looks like the Icons8 team may have been involved in developing that set. We can safely assume Google is careful enough to get the licensing details right.)
Yeh, I actually use Material icons on icons8 which are redrawn Material icons by Icons8. So it wouldn't be problem for me to find replacement to Icons8

From a visual standpoint, my favorite of the icon proposals is the Font Awesome one we had originally. A lot of these other options don't parse as a globe to me at the size we'll be using them at all -- they parse as a disk with a scribble inside. And I think "Is this immediately recognized as a globe" is a pretty important consideration for what we're using this icon for.

Second best on that standpoint are the globes with longitude/latitude lines, like what we currently have.

Which icon was that -- was it the one centered on North America?

Earlier in the thread, I felt that the Material Design version of that icon: image.png
https://fonts.google.com/icons?selected=Material+Icons&icon.query=globe

was somewhat more legible than that one, while based on the same concept. Also not quite so blatantly centered right on North America, which feels like an improvement.
FWIW on my screen the current globe looks… choppier, more pixelated, somehow than the other stream icons. image.png

@Tim Abbott I'm a bit confused by your comment. Could you help me to understand it?

my favorite of the icon proposals is the Font Awesome one we had originally

Which one is that exactly?
FA 4 globe: image.png

FA 6 globes image.png

"Is this immediately recognized as a globe"

For whom exactly? For North Americans? What if the icon is a pink color?

Here is the example of the Material Design Globe which I'm trying instead of wired version: image.png

And it is not 100% recognizable because the color of the land is blue and the color of the water is grey (transparent)

I don't think we have to fight for "the best recognition ever" because these icons are context related.
I thought we should avoid if an icon of a public stream could be confused with regular stream or private stream.
Aside from that any icon a person spends 3 days staring would be "recognizable for him".

Here is the icon of Google Chrome image.png. Can anybody tell me out of their head what is the meaning of it and what is the context? I'm sure you saw that at least once... Not an easy task.

It feels like we have 2 choices here:

  1. "Abstract globe" with minimum elements: image.png - Feather icons. Currently is used inside Zulip mobile app for "All messages" for some reason.
  2. "a disk with a scribble inside" - pick any but probably north americans should recognize it?

Vlad Korobov said:

  1. "Abstract globe" with minimum elements: image.png - Feather icons. Currently is used inside Zulip mobile app for "All messages" for some reason.

I'd certainly be happy to change that to something else.

It looks like the current icon on web for "All messages" is a sort of "list" icon: image.png

I'd be happy to switch to that on mobile. I don't recall what it used to be on web, but I don't think it was that, or else we'd have switched to it long ago.
We switched to the list icon from the home icon.

Screenshot-2022-03-17-at-5.56.15-PM.png

This icon looks like a good alternative to me as well.

Aman Agrawal (amanagr) said:

We switched to the list icon from the home icon.

Ah, right.

Yeah, when it was a "home" icon, we didn't want to use that in mobile because we felt it would put too much emphasis on the all-messages view -- the real "home" view for the mobile app is the screen showing your unreads.
Switching to the list icon for "All messages" on mobile sounds like a nice improvement in consistency of experience. @Greg Price should I file an issue for it?
I'd say yes except that I just started writing one myself :smile: Thanks!
#M5303

The Feature icon isn't working for me -- having part of Central/North America results in a much less distinctive shape:
https://chat.zulip.org/user_uploads/2/40/DwwMz2Sjb3FmnyqkrRK0X_JY/image.png

If we want a different continent than North America, I like Font Awesome 6 one, because Africa is a distinctive shape.

image.png

I think that's https://fontawesome.com/icons/earth-africa. However, we can only use the "solid" variant from Font Awesome specifically because their other variants are not OSS licensed.

Assume the jitsi link in there is accidental? (edit: now removed)

Though probably interesting to figure out how it happened.

And yeah, what I was saying is that the Font Awesome 4 which shows North America is I think the best on the "Distinctive shape" axis:
https://chat.zulip.org/user_uploads/2/1b/J71hFI1gUOHEBTSr0sARcIU0/image.png

We can pick a different one because we'd prefer to not be North America centric, but I do think a visually distinctive part of Earth geography is much better than a less recognizable one.

Alex Vandiver said:

Assume the jitsi link in there is accidental? (edit: now removed)

Though probably interesting to figure out how it happened.

I'm pretty sure this was just because the video call button is next to the preview button and I misclicked.
Which is an argument for moving the preview button someplace not adjacent to things that alter the contents of the box

Yeah, but this is the first time I've seen this happen in a few years of having the preview button between two things, so I wouldn't assume it's worth making any change motivated by a single instance of that :smile:

No, but I think it's also a clear example of "does a different thing than what it is surrounded by."

Anyways, this is a tangent, and the latest mockups I've seen do move it out of the insert-things-in-the-box area.
How about this one? image.png
I like the concept, but that image has a lot of detail -- I'd want to see how it comes out at a small size.
I like that one! I'd expect it to work at a small size after zooming it in the Zoom lightbox, but agree that it needs testing.
image.png
Yeah, I think that will work. Here's a crop around that icon, after zooming to around the size the real thing has on my screen: image.png

you can see it in context in 100% scale here https://www.figma.com/proto/jbNOiBWvbtLuHaiTj4CW0G/Zulip-2022?page-id=1392%3A88715&node-id=1392%3A95137&viewport=399%2C48%2C0.27&scaling=min-zoom&starting-point-node-id=1392%3A95137
Yeah, I think that'll work too. What's the icon's licensing situation?
https://github.com/ionic-team/ionicons/blob/main/LICENSE
Works for me!
Great, @Aman Agrawal (amanagr) want to put together a quick PR switching to that icon so we can test it? @Vlad Korobov it'd be helpful if you can provide the direct link to the SVG source.
icon-globe.svg
I got to tune it a bit, so its not actually 100% original

Please still provide a link to the original SVG source, and if changes were necessary, explain what you changed. It’s important that we have a record of these things, so we can document the licensing and attribution information in docs/THIRDPARTY, and so we can replicate the changes in the future if it becomes necessary.

Globe icon is from this set https://github.com/ionic-team/ionicons/blob/main/LICENSE
This is the direct link to the image https://unpkg.com/ionicons@5.5.2/dist/svg/earth-sharp.svg
I changed the outline around the globe.

I don't want to describe every change I made to every open source icon. If you guys define what is the amount of change required to make something legally not using third party icon I would perform such actions.
Once we be in the implementation phase I'll check every icon if it was an original one or from a particular package and make a note in Figma about it.
https://github.com/zulip/zulip/blob/main/docs/THIRDPARTY shows the lvel of detail we need for attribution; figured I'd show a link to make it easy to view.
(And then a few human-readable notes to specify what we did is all we need for reproducibility in the future)
I see there are links to some set of files but I don't see an example of reproducibility of an icon

Almost all of our icons that we didn’t make ourselves are referenced directly from NPM packages, so we don’t need to keep manual copies. The one exception is static/assets/icons/ellipsis-v-solid.svg, which has an entry in docs/THIRDPARTY.

Files: static/assets/icons/ellipsis-v-solid.svg
Copyright: 2017 Fonticons, Inc.
License: CC-BY-4.0
Comment: This icon is picked from Version 5.13.0 of Font Awesome

(And really we should fix that one to be an NPM reference too.)

If you guys define what is the amount of change required to make something legally not using third party icon I would perform such actions.

If you change someone else’s work, you’ve created a derivative work, so you need to respect their copyright and license. There’s no amount of change that absolves you of this responsibility. But it’s typically not hard for open-source licenses.

If you tell us that an icon came from https://unpkg.com/ionicons@5.5.2/dist/svg/earth-sharp.svg (actually isn’t it earth.svg?), and that you slightly thickened the border, that’s enough information for us to easily look up the legal information when we need to record it during implementation. It’s also just generally useful to know where we might find other icons in a similar style and how we might want to modify them to match.
Opened #21491
image.png
I'm test-deploying this revised globe icon now.
Due to a caching issue, you need to shift-reload your browser in order to see the revised icon that's been deployed here since yesterday.
Feedback on how the icon is working for folks would be much appreciated, since deciding what icon to go with for 5.0 is one of our few remaining things to do before we release.

Just shift-reloaded and I see it. I like it! Here's how it comes out on my screen: image.png

I think that's pretty legible, as icons go.

One thing that seems to be missing and would be good to add is a tooltip explaining what it means, so you can find out by hovering if you don't know.
